context.text: United States House of Representatives elections, 1980 - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
District Incumbent Party Elected Status Opponent
United States House of Representatives elections, 1980
Key to color code: Blue=Democratic pickup; Red=Republican pickup.
Key to party abbreviations: AI=American Independent, C=Constitution, D=Democrat, G=Green, I=Independent, IP=Independence Party, L=Libertarian, PF=Peace and Freedom, R=Republican.

The U.S. House election, 1980 was an election for the United States House of Representatives in 1980 which coincided with the election of Ronald Reagan as President . Reagan's victory also allowed many Republican House candidates to secure election, and the Republicans gained a net of 35 seats from the Democratic Party . The Democrats nonetheless retained a significant majority, unlike the Senate where Republicans gained control of the chamber. Many Democratic congressman from the south (known as "boll weevils") frequently took conservative stances on issues, allowing Republicans to have a working majority for most of President Reagan's proposals.
United States House of Representatives elections, 1980
